Quotes: All the armies of Europe, Asia and Africa combined, with all the treasure of the earth (our own excepted) in their military chest;with a Buonaparte for a commander, could not by force, take a drink from the Ohio, or make a track on the Blue Ridge, in a trial of a thousand years.
Author: Abraham Lincoln

Quotes: The people will save their government, if the government itself will allow them.
Author: Abraham Lincoln

Quotes: Discourage litigation. Persuade your neighbors to compromise whenever you can. As a peacemaker the lawyer has superior opportunity of being a good man. There will still be business enough.
Author: Abraham Lincoln

Quotes: Don't worry when you are not recognized, but strive to be worthy of recognition.
Author: Abraham Lincoln

Quotes: You have to be very rich or very poor to live without a trade.
Author: Albert Camus

Quotes: In order to exist just once in the world, it is necessary never again to exist.
Author: Albert Camus

Quotes: When you have really exhausted an experience you always reverence and love it.
Author: Albert Camus

Quotes: Note, besides, that it is no more immoral to directly rob citizens than to slip indirect taxes into the price of goods that they cannot do without.
Author: Albert Camus

Quotes: An intellectual is someone whose mind watches itself.
Author: Albert Camus

Quotes: Everything should be as simple as it is, but not simpler.
Author: Albert Einstein

Quotes: Peace cannot be kept by force;it can only be achieved by understanding.
Author: Albert Einstein

Quotes: The only thing that interferes with my learning is my education.
Author: Albert Einstein

Quotes: As far as the laws of mathematics refer to reality, they are not certain, and as far as they are certain, they do not refer to reality.
Author: Albert Einstein

Quotes: The important thing is not to stop questioning. Curiosity has its own reason for existing.
Author: Albert Einstein

Quotes: Silence is the wit of fools.
Author: Anatole France

Quotes: Wandering re-establishes the original harmony which once existed between man and the universe.
Author: Anatole France

Quotes: The law, in its majestic equality, forbids the rich as well as the poor to sleep under bridges, to beg in the streets, and to steal bread.
Author: Anatole France

Quotes: Devout believers are safeguarded in a high degree against the risk of certain neurotic illnesses;their acceptance of the universal neurosis spares them the task of constructing a personal one.
Author: Anatole France

Quotes: Republics decline into democracies and democracies degenerate into despotisms.
Author: Aristotel

Quotes: A constitution is the arrangement of magistracies in a state.
Author: Aristotel

Quotes: To lengthen thy life, lessen thy meals.
Author: Benjamin Franklin

Quotes: If you gain, you gain all. If you lose, you lose nothing. Wager then, without hesitation, that He exists.
Author: Blaise Pascal

Quotes: Justice and power must be brought together, so that whatever is just may be powerful, and whatever is powerful may be just.
Author: Blaise Pascal

Quotes: We view things not only from different sides, but with different eyes;we have no wish to find them alike.
Author: Blaise Pascal

Quotes: No one is useless in this world who lightens the burden of it to anyone else.
Author: Charles Dickens

Quotes: That sort of half sigh, which, accompanied by two or three slight nods of the head, is pity's small change in general society.
Author: Charles Dickens

Quotes: Although a skillful flatterer is a most delightful companion if you have him all to yourself, his taste becomes very doubtful when he takes to complimenting other people.
Author: Charles Dickens

Quotes: I have known a vast quantity of nonsense talked about bad men not looking you in the face. Don't trust that conventional idea. Dishonesty will stare honesty out of countenance any day in the week, if there is anything to be got by it.
Author: Charles Dickens

Quotes: The saddest thing I can imagine is to get used to luxury.
Author: Charlie Chaplin

Quotes: All my pictures are built around the idea of getting in trouble and so giving me the chance to be desperately serious in my attempt to appear as a normal little gentleman.
Author: Charlie Chaplin

Quotes: Rashness belongs to youth;prudence to old age.
Author: Cicero

Quotes: The best interpreter of the law is custom.
Author: Cicero

Quotes: Brevity is a great charm of eloquence.
Author: Cicero

Quotes: The eyes like sentinel occupy the highest place in the body.
Author: Cicero

Quotes: The greater the difficulty, the greater the glory.
Author: Cicero

Quotes: The safety of the people shall be the highest law.
Author: Cicero

Quotes: The higher we are placed, the more humbly we should walk.
Author: Cicero

Quotes: The precepts of the law are these: to live honestly, to injure no one, and to give everyone else his due.
Author: Cicero

Quotes: Like associates with like.
Author: Cicero

Quotes: No poet or orator has ever existed who believed there was any better than himself.
Author: Cicero

Quotes: Nothing is so strongly fortified that it cannot be taken by money.
Author: Cicero

Quotes: Let us not listen to those who think we ought to be angry with our enemies, and who believe this to be great and manly. Nothing is so praiseworthy, nothing so clearly shows a great and noble soul, as clemency and readiness to forgive.
Author: Cicero

Quotes: Those wars are unjust which are undertaken without provocation. For only a war waged for revenge or defense can be just.
Author: Cicero

Quotes: Laws should be interpreted in a liberal sense so that their intention may be preserved.
Author: Cicero

Quotes: Frivolity is inborn, conceit acquired by education.
Author: Cicero

Quotes: In everything, satiety closely follows the greatest pleasures.
Author: Cicero

Quotes: Luxury must be comfortable, otherwise it is not luxury.
Author: Coco Chanel

Quotes: When anger rises, think of the consequences.
Author: Confucius

Quotes: In a country well governed, poverty is something to be ashamed of. In a country badly governed, wealth is something to be ashamed of.
Author: Confucius

Quotes: Old age, believe me, is a good and pleasant thing. It is true you are gently shouldered off the stage, but then you are given such a comfortable front stall as spectator.
Author: Confucius

Quotes: I have always had this view about the modern education system: we pay attention to brain development, but the development of warmheartedness we take for granted.
Author: Dalai Lama

Quotes: The darkest places in hell are reserved for those who maintain their neutrality in times of moral crisis.
Author: Dante Alighieri

Quotes: At this high moment, ability failed my capacity to describe.
Author: Dante Alighieri

Quotes: Worldly fame is but a breath of wind that blows now this way, and now that, and changes name as it changes direction.
Author: Dante Alighieri

Quotes: Do not trust all men, but trust men of worth;the former course is silly, the latter a mark of prudence.
Author: Democritus

Quotes: Our first intuitions are the true ones.
Author: Emil Cioran

Quotes: We inhabit a language rather than a country.
Author: Emil Cioran

Quotes: We are born to Exist, not to know, to be, not to assert ourselves.
Author: Emil Cioran

Quotes: One hardly saves a world without ruling it.
Author: Emil Cioran

Quotes: Crime in full glory consolidates authority by the sacred fear it inspires.
Author: Emil Cioran

Quotes: What pride to discover that nothing belongs to you - what a revelation.
Author: Emil Cioran

Quotes: A golden rule: to leave an incomplete image of oneself.
Author: Emil Cioran

Quotes: Revenge is not always sweet, once it is consummated we feel inferior to our victim.
Author: Emil Cioran

Quotes: The Universal view melts things into a blur.
Author: Emil Cioran

Quotes: To exist is a habit I do not despair of acquiring.
Author: Emil Cioran

Quotes: We die in proportion to the words we fling around us.
Author: Emil Cioran

Quotes: By all evidence we are in the world to do nothing.
Author: Emil Cioran

Quotes: The mind is the result of the torments the flesh undergoes or inflicts upon itself.
Author: Emil Cioran

Quotes: If, at the limit, you can rule without crime, you cannot do so without injustices.
Author: Emil Cioran

Quotes: Isn't history ultimately the result of our fear of boredom?
Author: Emil Cioran

Quotes: It is because we are all imposters that we endure each other.
Author: Emil Cioran

Quotes: One does not inhabit a country;one inhabits a language. That is our country, our fatherland - and no other.
Author: Emil Cioran

Quotes: Progress is the injustice each generation commits with regard to its predecessors.
Author: Emil Cioran

Quotes: There is no means of proving it is preferable to be than not to be.
Author: Emil Cioran

Quotes: When I have an idea, I turn down the flame, as if it were a little alcohol stove, as low as it will go. Then it explodes and that is my idea.
Author: Ernest Hemingway

Quotes: Never mistake motion for action.
Author: Ernest Hemingway

Quotes: All things truly wicked start from innocence.
Author: Ernest Hemingway

Quotes: No weapon has ever settled a moral problem. It can impose a solution but it cannot guarantee it to be a just one.
Author: Ernest Hemingway

Quotes: They that will not apply new remedies must expect new evils.
Author: Francis Bacon

Quotes: Judges must beware of hard constructions and strained inferences, for there is no worse torture than that of laws.
Author: Francis Bacon

Quotes: It is in life as it is in ways, the shortest way is commonly the foulest, and surely the fairer way is not much about.
Author: Francis Bacon

Quotes: Money is like manure, of very little use except it be spread.
Author: Francis Bacon

Quotes: As one grows older, one becomes wiser and more foolish.
Author: Francois de La Rochefoucauld

Quotes: Fortune converts everything to the advantage of her favorites.
Author: Francois de La Rochefoucauld

Quotes: We confess our little faults to persuade people that we have no large ones.
Author: Francois de La Rochefoucauld

Quotes: Conceit causes more conversation than wit.
Author: Francois de La Rochefoucauld

Quotes: Nothing is so contagious as example;and we never do any great good or evil which does not produce its like.
Author: Francois de La Rochefoucauld

Quotes: If we did not flatter ourselves, the flattery of others could never harm us.
Author: Francois de La Rochefoucauld

Quotes: We have no patience with other people's vanity because it is offensive to our own.
Author: Francois de La Rochefoucauld

Quotes: I have always been an admirer. I regard the gift of admiration as indispensable if one is to amount to something;I don't know where I would be without it.
Author: Francois de La Rochefoucauld

Quotes: Repentance is not so much remorse for what we have done as the fear of the consequences.
Author: Francois de La Rochefoucauld

Quotes: The defects and faults of the mind are like wounds in the body;after all imaginable care has been taken to heal them up, still there will be a scar left behind, and they are in continual danger of breaking the skin and bursting out again.
Author: Francois de La Rochefoucauld

Quotes: Perfect Valor is to do, without a witness, all that we could do before the whole world.
Author: Francois de La Rochefoucauld

Quotes: What does not destroy me, makes me stronger.
Author: Friedrich Nietzsche

Quotes: Whoever has witnessed another's ideal becomes his inexorable judge and as it were his evil conscience.
Author: Friedrich Nietzsche

Quotes: The surest way to corrupt a youth is to instruct him to hold in higher esteem those who think alike than those who think differently.
Author: Friedrich Nietzsche

Quotes: And if you gaze for long into an abyss, the abyss gazes also into you.
Author: Friedrich Nietzsche

Quotes: The most important thing Paris gave me was a perspective on Latin America. It taught me the differences between Latin America and Europe and among the Latin American countries themselves through the Latins I met there.
Author: Gabriel Jose Garcia Marquez

Quotes: Property is organized robbery.
Author: George Bernard Shaw

Quotes: An asylum for the sane would be empty in America.
Author: George Bernard Shaw

Quotes: Youth is wasted on the young.
Author: George Bernard Shaw

Quotes: You see things;and you say "Why?" But I dream things that never were;and I say "Why not?
Author: George Bernard Shaw

Quotes: A fashion is nothing but an induced epidemic.
Author: George Bernard Shaw

Quotes: An index is a great leveller.
Author: George Bernard Shaw

Quotes: We are the only real aristocracy in the world: the aristocracy of money.
Author: George Bernard Shaw

Quotes: I am afraid we must make the world honest before we can honestly say to our children that honesty is the best policy.
Author: George Bernard Shaw

Quotes: Democracy is a device that insures we shall be governed no better than we deserve.
Author: George Bernard Shaw

Quotes: Perhaps the greatest social service that can be rendered by anybody to the country and to mankind is to bring up a family.
Author: George Bernard Shaw

Quotes: If you leave the smallest corner of your head vacant for a moment, other people's opinions will rush in from all quarters.
Author: George Bernard Shaw

Quotes: We should all be obliged to appear before a board every five years and justify our existence... on pain of liquidation.
Author: George Bernard Shaw

Quotes: Iteration, like friction, is likely to generate heat instead of progress.
Author: George Eliot

Quotes: All meanings, we know, depend on the key of interpretation.
Author: George Eliot

Quotes: The reward of one duty is the power to fulfill another.
Author: George Eliot

Quotes: Nothing is so good as it seems beforehand.
Author: George Eliot

Quotes: There is a great deal of unmapped country within us which would have to be taken into account in an explanation of our gusts and storms.
Author: George Eliot

Quotes: But that intimacy of mutual embarrassment, in which each feels that the other is feeling something, having once existed, its effect is not to be done away with.
Author: George Eliot

Quotes: Great things are not done by impulse, but by a series of small things brought together.
Author: George Eliot

Quotes: The years between fifty and seventy are the hardest. You are always being asked to do things, and yet you are not decrepit enough to turn them down.
Author: George Eliot

Quotes: The idea really came to me the day I got my new false teeth.
Author: George Orwell

Quotes: We sleep safe in our beds because rough men stand ready in the night to visit violence on those who would do us harm.
Author: George Orwell

Quotes: Big Brother is watching you.
Author: George Orwell

Quotes: Liberal: a power worshipper without power.
Author: George Orwell

Quotes: We may find in the long run that tinned food is a deadlier weapon than the machine-gun.
Author: George Orwell

Quotes: Doublethink means the power of holding two contradictory beliefs in one's mind simultaneously, and accepting both of them.
Author: George Orwell

Quotes: Power is not a means, it is an end. One does not establish a dictatorship in order to safeguard a revolution;one makes the revolution in order to establish the dictatorship.
Author: George Orwell

Quotes: History is more or less bunk.
Author: Henry Ford

Quotes: A business that makes nothing but money is a poor business.
Author: Henry Ford

Quotes: There is one rule for the industrialist and that is: Make the best quality of goods possible at the lowest cost possible, paying the highest wages possible.
Author: Henry Ford

Quotes: Business is never so healthy as when, like a chicken, it must do a certain amount of scratching around for what it gets.
Author: Henry Ford

Quotes: Towns find it as hard as houses of business to rise again from ruin.
Author: Honore de Balzac

Quotes: Our most bitter enemies are our own kith and kin. Kings have no brothers, no sons, no mother!
Author: Honore de Balzac

Quotes: Modesty is the conscience of the body.
Author: Honore de Balzac

Quotes: But reason always cuts a poor figure beside sentiment;the one being essentially restricted, like everything that is positive, while the other is infinite.
Author: Honore de Balzac

Quotes: Insults are the arguments employed by those who are in the wrong.
Author: Jean Jacques Rousseau

Quotes: How many famous and high-spirited heroes have lived a day too long?
Author: Jean Jacques Rousseau

Quotes: Nothing is to be rated higher than the value of the day.
Author: Johann Wolfgang von Goethe

Quotes: Divide and rule, the politician cries;unite and lead, is watchword of the wise.
Author: Johann Wolfgang von Goethe

Quotes: Go to foreign countries and you will get to know the good things one possesses at home.
Author: Johann Wolfgang von Goethe

Quotes: The people who are absent are the ideal;those who are present seem to be quite commonplace.
Author: Johann Wolfgang von Goethe

Quotes: To hard necessity ones will and fancy must conform.
Author: Johann Wolfgang von Goethe

Quotes: The career of a sage is of two kinds: He is either honored by all in the world, Like a flower waving its head, Or else he disappears into the silent forest.
Author: Lao Tzu

Quotes: Violence, even well intentioned, always rebounds upon oneself.
Author: Lao Tzu

Quotes: He who is contented is rich.
Author: Lao Tzu

Quotes: Be the chief but never the lord.
Author: Lao Tzu

Quotes: People in their handlings of affairs often fail when they are about to succeed. If one remains as careful at the end as he was at the beginning, there will be no failure.
Author: Lao Tzu

Quotes: To withdraw myself from myself has ever been my sole, my entire, my sincere motive in scribbling at all.
Author: Lord Byron

Quotes: Society is now one polished horde, formed of two mighty tries, the Bores and Bored.
Author: Lord Byron

Quotes: He who surpasses or subdues mankind, must look down on the hate of those below.
Author: Lord Byron

Quotes: Folly loves the martyrdom of fame.
Author: Lord Byron

Quotes: Prolonged endurance tames the bold.
Author: Lord Byron

Quotes: Where there is mystery, it is generally suspected there must also be evil.
Author: Lord Byron

Quotes: My turn of mind is so given to taking things in the absurd point of view, that it breaks out in spite of me every now and then.
Author: Lord Byron

Quotes: A powerful idea communicates some of its strength to him who challenges it.
Author: Marcel Proust

Quotes: All our final decisions are made in a state of mind that is not going to last.
Author: Marcel Proust

Quotes: It is always during a passing state of mind that we make lasting resolutions.
Author: Marcel Proust

Quotes: The only real voyage of discovery consists not in seeking new landscapes but in having new eyes.
Author: Marcel Proust

Quotes: The voyage of discovery is not in seeking new landscapes but in having new eyes.
Author: Marcel Proust

Quotes: After all, science is essentially international, and it is only through lack of the historical sense that national qualities have been attributed to it.
Author: Marie Curie

Quotes: Civilization is the limitless multiplication of unnecessary necessities.
Author: Mark Twain

Quotes: Never put off till tomorrow what you can do the day after tomorrow.
Author: Mark Twain

Quotes: A man who carries a cat by the tail learns something he can learn in no other way.
Author: Mark Twain

Quotes: The finest clothing made is a person's own skin, but, of course, society demands something more than this.
Author: Mark Twain

Quotes: The educated Southerner has no use for an 'R', except at the beginning of a word.
Author: Mark Twain

Quotes: I find myself fascinating.
Author: Milan Kundera

Quotes: If we have no peace, it is because we have forgotten that we belong to each other.
Author: Mother Teresa

Quotes: We ourselves feel that what we are doing is just a drop in the ocean. But the ocean would be less because of that missing drop.
Author: Mother Teresa

Quotes: Princes and governments are far more dangerous than other elements within society.
Author: Niccolo Machiavelli

Quotes: No enterprise is more likely to succeed than one concealed from the enemy until it is ripe for execution.
Author: Niccolo Machiavelli

Quotes: Experience is one thing you can't get for nothing.
Author: Oscar Wilde

Quotes: Deceiving others. That is what the world calls a romance.
Author: Oscar Wilde

Quotes: Experience is simply the name we give our mistakes.
Author: Oscar Wilde

Quotes: If one could only teach the English how to talk, and the Irish how to listen, society here would be quite civilized.
Author: Oscar Wilde

Quotes: In America the young are always ready to give to those who are older than themselves the full benefits of their inexperience.
Author: Oscar Wilde

Quotes: America is the only country that went from barbarism to decadence without civilization in between.
Author: Oscar Wilde

Quotes: Whenever a man does a thoroughly stupid thing, it is always from the noblest motives.
Author: Oscar Wilde

Quotes: Others have seen what is and asked why. I have seen what could be and asked why not.
Author: Pablo Picasso

Quotes: I don't believe in accidents. There are only encounters in history. There are no accidents.
Author: Pablo Picasso

Quotes: Power without abuse loses its charm.
Author: Paul Valery

Quotes: Two dangers constantly threaten the world: order and disorder.
Author: Paul Valery

Quotes: Our judgments judge us, and nothing reveals us, exposes our weaknesses, more ingeniously than the attitude of pronouncing upon our fellows.
Author: Paul Valery

Quotes: History is the science of things which are not repeated.
Author: Paul Valery

Quotes: Politeness is organized indifference.
Author: Paul Valery

Quotes: The future, like everything else, is not what it used to be.
Author: Paul Valery

Quotes: The universe is built on a plan the profound symmetry of which is somehow present in the inner structure of our intellect.
Author: Paul Valery

Quotes: MySpace is an addiction.
Author: Paulo Coelho

Quotes: Be brave. Take risks. Nothing can substitute experience.
Author: Paulo Coelho

Quotes: There is no harm in repeating a good thing.
Author: Plato

Quotes: They do certainly give very strange, and newfangled, names to diseases.
Author: Plato

Quotes: The highest reach of injustice is to be deemed just when you are not.
Author: Plato

Quotes: Only the dead have seen the end of war.
Author: Plato

Quotes: The rulers of the state are the only persons who ought to have the privilege of lying, either at home or abroad;they may be allowed to lie for the good of the state.
Author: Plato

Quotes: The curse of me and my nation is that we always think things can be bettered by immediate action of some sort, any sort rather than no sort.
Author: Plato

Quotes: The community which has neither poverty nor riches will always have the noblest principles.
Author: Plato

Quotes: A state arises, as I conceive, out of the needs of mankind;no one is self-sufficing, but all of us have many wants.
Author: Plato

Quotes: Ignorance of all things is an evil neither terrible nor excessive, nor yet the greatest of all;but great cleverness and much learning, if they be accompanied by a bad training, are a much greater misfortune.
Author: Plato

Quotes: The first and greatest victory is to conquer yourself;to be conquered by yourself is of all things most shameful and vile.
Author: Plato

Quotes: For a man to conquer himself is the first and noblest of all victories.
Author: Plato

Quotes: Entire ignorance is not so terrible or extreme an evil, and is far from being the greatest of all;too much cleverness and too much learning, accompanied with ill bringing-up, are far more fatal.
Author: Plato

Quotes: There will be no end to the troubles of states, or of humanity itself, till philosophers become kings in this world, or till those we now call kings and rulers really and truly become philosophers, and political power and philosophy thus come into the same hands.
Author: Plato

Quotes: Good people do not need laws to tell them to act responsibly, while bad people will find a way around the laws.
Author: Plato

Quotes: We come nearest to the great when we are great in humility.
Author: Rabindranath Tagore

Quotes: Journalism keeps you planted in the earth.
Author: Ray Bradbury

Quotes: If you enjoy living, it is not difficult to keep the sense of wonder.
Author: Ray Bradbury

Quotes: Everything is generated through your own will power.
Author: Ray Bradbury

Quotes: Enjoy present pleasures in such a way as not to injure future ones.
Author: Seneca

Quotes: The usual approach of science of constructing a mathematical model cannot answer the questions of why there should be a universe for the model to describe. Why does the universe go to all the bother of existing?
Author: Stephen Hawking

Quotes: It is more dangerous that even a guilty person should be punished without the forms of law than that he should escape.
Author: Thomas Jefferson

Quotes: Money, not morality, is the principle commerce of civilized nations.
Author: Thomas Jefferson

Quotes: No man will ever carry out of the Presidency the reputation which carried him into it.
Author: Thomas Jefferson

Quotes: Habit is the nursery of errors.
Author: Victor Hugo

Quotes: Mankind is not a circle with a single center but an ellipse with two focal points of which facts are one and ideas the other.
Author: Victor Hugo

Quotes: One has to secrete a jelly in which to slip quotations down people's throats - and one always secretes too much jelly.
Author: Virginia Woolf

Quotes: If we help an educated man's daughter to go to Cambridge are we not forcing her to think not about education but about war? - not how she can learn, but how she can fight in order that she might win the same advantages as her brothers?
Author: Virginia Woolf

Quotes: It is curious how instinctively one protects the image of oneself from idolatry or any other handling that could make it ridiculous, or too unlike the original to be believed any longer.
Author: Virginia Woolf

Quotes: History is only the register of crimes and misfortunes.
Author: Voltaire

Quotes: Governments need to have both shepherds and butchers.
Author: Voltaire

Quotes: Every one goes astray, but the least imprudent are they who repent the soonest.
Author: Voltaire

Quotes: An ideal form of government is democracy tempered with assassination.
Author: Voltaire

Quotes: The true triumph of reason is that it enables us to get along with those who do not possess it.
Author: Voltaire

Quotes: Whoever serves his country well has no need of ancestors.
Author: Voltaire

Quotes: Appreciation is a wonderful thing: It makes what is excellent in others belong to us as well.
Author: Voltaire

Quotes: The best government is a benevolent tyranny tempered by an occasional assassination.
Author: Voltaire

Quotes: Or heritage and ideals, our code and standards - the things we live by and teach our children - are preserved or diminished by how freely we exchange ideas and feelings.
Author: Walt Disney

Quotes: We believed in our idea - a family park where parents and children could have fun- together.
Author: Walt Disney

Quotes: My pride fell with my fortunes.
Author: William Shakespeare

Quotes: For I can raise no money by vile means.
Author: William Shakespeare

Quotes: An overflow of good converts to bad.
Author: William Shakespeare

Quotes: My crown is called content, a crown that seldom kings enjoy.
Author: William Shakespeare

Quotes: Poor and content is rich, and rich enough.
Author: William Shakespeare

Quotes: There's not a note of mine that's worth the noting.
Author: William Shakespeare
